Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Make August more human with message splitting

New communication style:
- Split longer responses into multiple short messages
- Use "---" delimiter to break up thoughts
- Each message 2-3 sentences max (like texting)
- 0.5s delay between messages for natural flow
- Emphasis on casual, conversational language

Bot changes:
- Added asyncio for message delays
- Parse "---" delimiter and send separate messages
- Fallback to plain text if Markdown fails

Prompt changes:
- Updated examples to show message splitting
- Added explicit rules: "talk like texting a friend"
- Removed verbose paragraph-style examples

Result: August now feels like chatting with a real PM instead of reading documentation.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add quick acknowledgment for slow responses

New feature:
- If GPT takes >5 seconds, August sends immediate acknowledgment
- Random variations: "Hold on, thinking...", "Give me a sec...", etc.
- Uses ThreadPoolExecutor to run OpenAI calls non-blocking
- After 5s timeout, sends quick message then waits for full response

User experience:
- No more awkward silence
- Feels more responsive and human
- Like texting someone who''s typing

Technical:
- asyncio.wait_for with 5s timeout
- Runs OpenAI call in executor thread
- Falls back gracefully if timeout occurs

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
